Wow, that is quick!

I tried various stuff, e.g.
 cat IAH-20070329193940-00=
000-res.arc | grep 'seznam'
or
 vi IAH-20070329193940-00000-res.arc
(vi tel=
ls me on "set encoding" that the file is UTF8)

I always get the mangling. =
I also tried
wget http://www.atcomp.cz/webservices/dokumenty.asmx
I end up =
with a similar mess.

However if I use my windows machine to fetch the file=
 and scp to
transfer it to the debian machine, I can see all the chars corr=
ectly,
this is why I suspect something is happening (or not happening) duri=
ng
the fetching or writing process... Can it be that the broswers (I used
f=
irefox) do some clever autofixing?

BTW the locale installed on the debian =
machine is: "de_DE.UTF-8 UTF-8"
(/etc/locale.gen). I also tried to install =
all available locales, but
same result.

thanks for the quick answer.

 /ho=
lger






Michael Stack wrote:
> 
> 
> Tell us more.
> 
> Heritrix writes =
the raw captured bytes untampered.
> 
> What are you using to view the ARCW=
riterProcessor captures? The page
> you point to in the below does not expl=
icitly state its encoding.
> Perhaps it needs this hint to rendor the pages=
 properly? For example,
> if I force my browser to render the page using IS=
O-8859-1 rather than
> UTF-8, I see the mangling you reproduce below.
> 
> =
St.Ack

laim is correctly utf8, I am running a debian
